# This Python 3 environment comes with many helpful analytics libraries installed
# It is defined by the kaggle/python Docker image: https://github.com/kaggle/docker-python
# For example, here's several helpful packages to load

import numpy as np # linear algebra
import pandas as pd # data processing, CSV file I/O (e.g. pd.read_csv)

# Input data files are available in the read-only "../input/" directory
# For example, running this (by clicking run or pressing Shift+Enter) will list all files under the input directory

import os
for dirname, _, filenames in os.walk('/kaggle/input'):
    for filename in filenames:
        print(os.path.join(dirname, filename))

# You can write up to 5GB to the current directory (/kaggle/working/) that gets preserved as output when you create a version using "Save & Run All" 
# You can also write temporary files to /kaggle/temp/, but they won't be saved outside of the current session

import pandas as pd
import numpy
source.46eff46b:
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import seaborn as sns
import plotly.express as px
source.59cb55cd:
Demo = pd.read_csv("/kaggle/input/Customer Demographics.csv")
Add = pd.read_csv("/kaggle/input/Customer Address.csv")
Tran = pd.read_csv("/kaggle/input/Transactions.csv")
New = pd.read_csv("/kaggle/input/New Customer list.csv")
source.dac1e755:
Demo[["Year","Month","Day"]] = Demo["DOB"].str.split('-',expand=True).replace(numpy.nan,0).astype(int)
Demo["Age"] = (2020 - Demo["Year"])
Demo["Age"].replace(2020,0, inplace=True)
# Demo["Age"].replace(177,0, inplace=True)
Demo.drop([0],axis = 0,inplace=True)


Demo
source.d31662b2:
# job_industry_category
# gender
# Age
# wealth_segment
# owns_car
# tenure

# with    past_3_years_bike_related_purchases
source.41e38d0c:
Demo.loc[Demo["gender"] == "Male" ,"Gender"] = 1
Demo.loc[Demo["gender"] == "Female" ,"Gender"] = 0


Demo.loc[Demo["job_industry_category"] == "Argiculture" ,"Department"] = 1
Demo.loc[Demo["job_industry_category"] == "Entertainment" ,"Department"] = 2
Demo.loc[Demo["job_industry_category"] == "Financial Services" ,"Department"] = 3
Demo.loc[Demo["job_industry_category"] == "Health" ,"Department"] = 4
Demo.loc[Demo["job_industry_category"] == "IT" ,"Department"] = 5
Demo.loc[Demo["job_industry_category"] == "Manufacturing" ,"Department"] = 6
Demo.loc[Demo["job_industry_category"] == "Property" ,"Department"] = 7
Demo.loc[Demo["job_industry_category"] == "Retail" ,"Department"] = 8
Demo.loc[Demo["job_industry_category"] == "Telecommunications" ,"Department"] = 9
Demo["Department"].replace(numpy.nan,0,inplace=True)

Demo.loc[Demo["wealth_segment"] == "Mass Customer" ,"Wealth"] = 1
Demo.loc[Demo["wealth_segment"] == "High Net Worth" ,"Wealth"] = 2
Demo.loc[Demo["wealth_segment"] == "Affluent Customer" ,"Wealth"] = 3


Demo.loc[Demo["owns_car"] == "No" ,"Car"] = 0
Demo.loc[Demo["owns_car"] == "Yes" ,"Car"] = 1
source.8fa8b319:
plt.figure(figsize=(30,10))
A = sns.distplot(Demo["tenure"],color="b",label="Department")
B = sns.distplot(Demo["Age"],color="r",label="Age of Customers",ax=A)
# C = sns.distplot(Demo["Wealth"],color="g",label="Department",ax=B)
sns.distplot(Demo["past_3_years_bike_related_purchases"],color="y",label="Past Records",ax=B)

New[["Year","Month","Day"]] = New["DOB"].str.split('-',expand=True).replace(numpy.nan,0).astype(int)
New["Age"] = (2020 - New["Year"])
New["Age"].replace(2020,0, inplace=True)
# Demo["Age"].replace(177,0, inplace=True)
New.drop([0],axis = 0,inplace=True)
